intro: Clypeola lasiocarpa, commonly known as the rough-haircup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are covered in dense, rough hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. The showy yellow flowers appear in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
